meanings.definition: The growth or movement of an organism in response to gravity.
meanings.sent1: The geotropism of the plant causes it to bend towards the ground.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study geotropism to understand how plants adapt to their environment.
meanings.sent3: The geotropism of the tree made it look like it was bowing to the earth.
meanings.sent4: The geotropism of the vines reaching for the soil was like nature's own compass pointing downwards.
meanings.sent5: The geotropism of the seedling was a beautiful dance with gravity.

meanings.definition: The tendency of plant roots to grow downward in response to gravity.
meanings.sent1: The geotropism of the roots helps anchor the plant securely in the soil.
meanings.sent2: Gardening enthusiasts often observe geotropism in action as roots seek nutrients below.
meanings.sent3: The geotropism of the flower pot made it seem like the plant was diving headfirst into the ground.
meanings.sent4: The geotropism of the roots was like a silent force pulling the plant deeper into the earth.
meanings.sent5: The geotropism of the roots was a constant reminder of nature's downward pull.
